articles.title: Unraveling the Mysteries of Europeans Re-Opening Graves 1,400 Years Ago - Science Times
articles.description: Archeologists are trying to understand why the bizarre practice of re-opening medieval graves in the late 6th century was recorded from Transylvania to Southern England.
articles.content: Citizens of Europe, roughly 1,400 years ago, had an unusual habit of re-opening graves and removing objects. This practice has stumped archaeologists for years; now, a study aims to unravel the myste… [+3237 chars]

articles.title: Focus starting to shift from cases to hospitalisations, Europe News & Top Stories - The Straits Times
articles.description: LONDON • After more than a year of obsessively tracking Covid-19 case numbers, epidemiologists are starting to shift their focus to other measures as the next stage of the pandemic emerges.. Read more at straitstimes.com.

articles.content: Xherdan Shaqiri scored two superb goals as Switzerland secured third place in Group A at Euro 2020 with a 3-1 win over Turkey, but they now face an anxious wait to see if they will reach the last 16.… [+3124 chars]

articles.author: Sporting News
articles.title: Gosens gains glorious revenge on Ronaldo as Germany stun Portugal in Euro 2020 cracker - Goal.com
articles.description: The 2021 Euros feature 24 teams vying for the European Championship for national teams. The tournament starts off with a round-robin group stage followed by knockout rounds through the final on July 11. Check out the latest standings and results.
